intro: Lastrea undulata, commonly known as the undulating lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly wavy edge, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically tubular and come in shades of red, purple, or pink, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Lastrea undulata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
